meanings.definition: A strong desire to travel and explore the world.
meanings.sent1: Her wanderlust led her to book a spontaneous trip to a faraway land.
meanings.sent2: His wanderlust was evident in the many travel souvenirs decorating his room.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to have a case of wanderlust, always trying to sneak out of the house.
meanings.sent4: His eyes sparkled with wanderlust as he listened to tales of distant lands.
meanings.sent5: The wanderlust in her heart burned brighter with each passing day.

meanings.definition: A deep longing for adventure and new experiences.
meanings.sent1: The young boy's wanderlust was palpable as he eagerly packed his backpack.
meanings.sent2: She embraced her wanderlust by trying out different cuisines from around the world.
meanings.sent3: His wanderlust for trying extreme sports sometimes got him into funny situations.
meanings.sent4: In his eyes, she saw a reflection of her own wanderlust for the unknown.
meanings.sent5: The wanderlust in his soul whispered of uncharted territories waiting to be explored.
